name: Leaf Blight
symptoms: Yellow to brown patches on leaves, leaf edges becoming dry and brittle, leaf tips turning brown, overall wilting of the plant.
remedy: Remove infected leaves, ensure proper spacing between plants for air circulation, avoid overhead watering, apply copper-based fungicides if necessary.

name: Powdery Mildew
symptoms: White powdery spots on leaves and stems, stunted growth, distorted leaves, premature leaf drop, reduced yield.
remedy: Increase air circulation around plants, avoid overhead watering, apply neem oil or sulfur-based fungicides, remove and destroy infected plant parts.

name: Aphid Infestation
symptoms: Curled or distorted leaves, sticky residue on leaves (honeydew), presence of small green, black or white insects on stems and leaf undersides, stunted growth.
remedy: Spray plants with strong water jet to dislodge aphids, introduce beneficial insects like ladybugs, apply insecticidal soap or neem oil, remove heavily infested parts.

name: Root Rot
symptoms: Wilting despite adequate water, yellowing leaves, stunted growth, soft, brown roots that may have foul odor, plant collapse.
remedy: Improve soil drainage, reduce watering frequency, remove affected plants, apply fungicide as soil drench, sterilize containers before replanting.

name: Foot and Mouth Disease
symptoms: Fever, blisters on mouth, feet, and teats, excessive salivation, lameness, reduced appetite, weight loss, reduced milk production in dairy animals.
remedy: Isolate infected animals, provide soft food and clean water, clean affected areas with antiseptic solution, administer pain relief and anti-inflammatory medication, contact veterinarian immediately.

name: Mastitis
symptoms: Swollen, red, hot, painful udder, abnormal milk (watery, flaky, or bloody), fever, reduced appetite, decreased milk production.
remedy: Regularly milk out affected quarters, apply warm compresses, administer antibiotics as prescribed by veterinarian, provide clean bedding, isolate infected animals.

name: Newcastle Disease
symptoms: Respiratory distress, greenish diarrhea, depression, lack of appetite, twisted neck (torticollis), paralysis, decreased egg production, tremors.
remedy: Vaccination is the best prevention, isolate sick birds, improve sanitation, administer supportive care, provide clean water and well-ventilated housing.

name: Bloat
symptoms: Swollen left abdomen, discomfort and pain, rapid breathing, excessive salivation, inability to belch, collapse in severe cases.
remedy: Keep animal standing, administer anti-bloat medication as prescribed by veterinarian, use stomach tube to release gas, in emergency situations perform trocarization, modify diet to prevent recurrence.
